column3: Great job passing all the autotests!
Looks good!
In-line comments are required for more complex code. You have some, but more is needed.
Protected attributes that start with an underscore should not be accessed from outside of the class!
super() isn't needed to call inherited methods when there's no ambiguity. Use self instead.
Not every method needs to return! Notice the docstrings/doctests and lab instructions.
In various locations, there's more loops than necessary. Aim for the most efficient code possible.
Using helper methods for repeated chunks of code would make code less redundant.
Great use of helper methods to make clean code!
It was required to turn in something for Part 1, so that you could receive feedback.
Instead of hardcoding 4 everywhere, should use Board.get_rows() or cols().
You can use a dict to keep track of locations, but the keys of a dictionary should be immutable. BoggleCubes are mutable.
Nice use of math to determine which CUBE_FACES to use!
Nice use of arithmetic for figuring out which CUBE_FACES.
When you shake the cubes, their location changes and so you need to update your locations dictionary. This is likely causing the failed autotest in testq2_adjacent_again.
Return statement could be simplified by returning the boolean expression directly (or by using absolute value to condense statements into one).
Need to check that cube1 isn't the same cube as cube2 prior to checking adjacency.
It should not be possible to allow a cube to be selected more than once. This should likely be handled in BoggleBoard.report_selection().
Should set self._board attribute to None in
Should only report_selection if _board is not None.
Otherwise, BoggleCube looks good!
Use loops to generate BoggleCubes instead of hardcoding. Repetitive code means we have more efficient options!
Should clear out green textlist and blue textbox at start.
Do not hardcode upper left corner of the CubeGraphic placement! Use Game.get_playarea_x() or y(), makes code more generalizable.
Instead of hardcoding 4 everywhere, should use Board.get_rows() or cols().
Helper methods for common actions, like resetting the board, could be helpful!
.click() is being called after the text boxes are updated, so the graphical game isn't updating correctly.
Use loops to generate CubeGraphics instead of hardcoding. Repetitive code means we have more efficient options!
Remove debugging print statements before submitting code.
